summary.seg:
The manuscript contains a rich collection of Greek astrological and divinatory texts. Among them there are various texts of onomancy, divination based on the subject's name, and, mostly, geomancy, the divination based on the interpretation of figures drawn on the basis of a casual number of points made in the earth or sand with a chisel. Various of the texts are still unpublished. The same collection of texts, in the same order, is found in MS
Firenze, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Plut. 86.14 , copied by the Florentine scribe Lorenzo Zanobi Ciatti (D. Speranzi, 'Tra Creta e Firenze. Aristobulo Apostolis, Marco Musuro e il Riccardiano 77', in: Segno e Testo 4 (2006), pp. 191-210,, 204 note 47; see also Rapisarda-Calcagno 2016, pp. 154-155 and note 10) in the 15th century.

Among the geomantic texts, MS R.15.36 contains a still unpublished treatise, Ἡ τέχνη τοῦ λαξευτηρίου ('The art of the chisel'; the term has been read as referring to the object used for tracing the geomantic shapes), which is a translation in Greek from Latin, made by Nicholas of Otranto (1219-1235; as a monk he took the name of Nectarius), who became abbot of the well-known Byzantine monastery of Casole, in Southern Italy (on this text see A. Delatte, L. Delatte, 'Un traité byzantin de géomancie', in: Mélanges Franz Cumont (Annuaire de l'Institut de Philologie et d'Histoire Orientales et Slaves 4), 1936, pp. 575-658, J.M. Hoeck, R.J. Loenertz, Nikolaos-Nektarios von Otranto Abt von Casole. Beiträge zur Geschichte der ost-westlichen Beziehungen unter Innozenz III. und Friedrich II. (Studia Patristica et Byzantina 11), Passau 1965, pp. 69-74, Rapisarda-Calcagno 2016, pp. 167-169, Giannachi 2017, pp. 221-222, with bibliography).

The script, and the decoration seem to indicate an origin for this manuscript in the 14th century, in the region of Otranto in Southern Italy, the same milieu where the geomantic text of Nicholas/Nactarius was composed.

msItem.title: Astrological texts about the position of the sun and the moon in the Zodiac
msItem.note: The same texts are present in this manuscript on ff. 3r-4r; the text, unpublished, is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 27r-28r

msItem.rubric: f. 1r l. 1 Μέθοδος τοῦ γνῶναι, ποίω ζωδίω ἴσταται ὁ ἥλιος καὶ πόσων μοιρῶν ἐστίν
msItem.incipit: f. 1r Κράτισον ἀπὸ μηνὸς σεπτεμβρίου ἠμέρα λ΄
msItem.explicit: f. 1r l. 16 καὶ τόσων μοιρῶν ἐστίν

msItem.incipit: f. 1r l. 17 Δωδεκαπλασίασον
msItem.note: A title has been added by another hand, Διὰ τῆς σελήνης μέθοδός ἐστιν αὐτή

msItem.title: Magical recipes
msItem.incipit: f. 2r l. 22 Πρὸς τὸ μὴ ἐπιθυμήσαι ἄνδρα γυναικὸς, καὶ γυναῖκα ἀνδρός. Χοίριον γάλλα λαβών
msItem.note: Ed. A. Delatte, Anecdota Atheniensia, 1, Liège-Paris 1927, p. 625 (the published text does not contain the last 5 lines of the text in the manuscript)

msItem.title: Astrological text about the position of the sun and the moon in the Zodiac
msItem.note: The same text is present in this manuscript on ff. 1r-2r; the text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 27r-28r

msItem.rubric: f. 3r l. 1 Μέθοδος τοῦ γνῶναι ἐν ποίω ζωδίω ἴσταται ὁ ἥλιος καὶ πόσων μοιρῶν ἐστίν
msItem.incipit: f. 3r Κράτισον ἀπὸ μηνὸς σεπτεμβρίου ἠμέρα λ΄
msItem.explicit: f. 3r l. 13 καὶ τόσων μοιρῶν ἐστίν

msItem.rubric: f. 3r l. 14 Ἡ δὲ τῆς σελήνης μέθοδος ἔστιν αὔτη
msItem.incipit: f. 3r Δωδεκαπλασίασον

msItem.title: Prognostica ratio euangelii et psalterii
msItem.rubric: f. 4v Μέθοδος προγνωστικὴ, τοῦ ἁγίου εὐαγγελίου καὶ τοῦ ψαλτηρίου, ποίημα κυροῦ Λέωντος τοῦ σοφοῦ
msItem.incipit: f. 4v Λαβὼν τὸ ἅγιον εὐαγγέλιον ἢ τὸ ψαλτήριον
msItem.explicit: f. 7r l. 6 εἰς τὸ ἐνάντιον μετὰ τρέπει
msItem.note: The text is attributed to Leo VI, Emperor of the East (866-912) Leo VI, Emperor of the East, 866-912 , called the Wise or Philosopher
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 28v-30r

Ed. (from MS Laur. Plut. 86.14) F. Filimon, 'The prediction method by means of the Holy Gospel and the Psalter: a late Byzantine case of a reassigned geomantic text', in: P. Magdalino, A. Timotin (ed.), Savoirs prédictifs et techniques divinatoires de l'Antiquité tardive à Byzance, Seyssel 2019, pp. 235-301 : 286-292; MS R.15.36 is indicated as C

msItem.title: Astrological text on how to know the Zodiac sign of birth
msItem.rubric: f. 7r l. 7 Πῶϛ ὀφείλειϛ εὐρεῖν τὸ ζώδιον ἐν ὧ ἐγεννήθηϛ
msItem.incipit: f. 7r Λάβε τὰ στοιχεῖα τοῦ ὀνόματός σου
msItem.note: The text is unpublished; it is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 30rv

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.note: The text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 30v-32r

msItem.rubric: f. 7v l. 1 Εὐχὴ τοῦ Λαξευτηρίου
msItem.incipit: f. 7v Ὁ ἀμέτριτον ἔχων τὴν δύναμιν
msItem.explicit: f. 7v l. 16 καὶ πάντων τῶν ἁγίων, ἀμήν

msItem.incipit: f. 7v l. 17 Σχῆμα πρῶτον ἐστὶν ἡ ὀδός

msItem.rubric: f. 9v l. 8 Ἑρμηνεία
msItem.incipit: f. 9v Γίνοσκε ὅτι ῥίζα τοῦ ῥαμπλίου
msItem.explicit: f. 10r l. 2 καὶ τὰ ιβ΄ σχήματα
msItem.note: Ed. Mélanges Franz Cumont, Bruxelles 1936, pp. 594-597
The text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 32r-32v

msItem.rubric: f. 10r l. 3 Ἑρμήνεια τῶν ιβ΄ σχημάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 10r Ὅτι τὸ α΄ δηλοῖ εἰς τὴν ζωήν
msItem.note: The text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 32v-34r

msItem.title: Astrological text
msItem.incipit: f. 11v l. 22 Περὶ ὑγείας. Ἐν παραδείγματι

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.rubric: f. 15v l. 3 Εὐχὴ τοῦ αὐτοῦ
msItem.incipit: f. 15v Παντοκράτωρ Θεὲ οὐράνιε
msItem.explicit: f. 15v l. 8 ἐπὶ τῆ ζητουμένη μου γνώσει, ἀμήν

msItem.title: Arithmetic onomantic tables
msItem.rubric: f. 15v l. 9 Τοῦ Πυθαγόρου πληνθίδες
msItem.note:
The text is constituted by onomantic calculations in tables; in the manuscript it is attributed to
Pythagoras
Pythagoras
Ed. Notices et extraits des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque Nationale et autres bibliothèques, 31, 2, p. 251 (= J.-L. Heiberg, H.-G. Zenthen (eds.), Paul Tannery, Mémoires scientifiques, 9, p. 38)
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 37r-38r, see also D. Bassi, F. Cumont, E. Martini, A. Olivieri, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum graecorum, 4, Bruxelles 1903, p. 41

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 16r Μικρὸν λαξευτήριον [...]
msItem.incipit: f. 16r Περὶ τελιώσεως
msItem.note: Ed. P. Tannery, Notices et extraits des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque Nationale et autres bibliothèques, 31.2, Paris 1886, p. 258 no. 10 (= J.-L. Heiberg, H.-G. Zenthen (eds.), Paul Tannery, Mémoires scientifiques, 9, p. 47 no.10)

msItem.title: Onomantic text attributed to Pythagoras
msItem.rubric: f. 17v Ψῆφος Πηθαγορικὸς πρὸς τὸ γνῶναι περὶ μονομαχίας τὶς νικήσει καὶ τὶς ἡττᾶται [...]
msItem.incipit: f. 17v Πυθαγόρας Εἰλιάδει χαίρειν. Πολλὰ καταμαθὼν

list.item: f. 18r Περὶ τοῦ γνῶναι τὸν κλέπτην
f. 18r Περὶ ἀρόστου εἰ ζήσει ἢ κινδυνεύει

msItem.note:
The text is attributed to
Pythagoras
Pythagoras and is accompanied by tables

Ed. P. Tannery, Notices et extraits des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque Nationale et autres bibliothèques, 31.2, , Paris 1886, pp. 248-250 no. IV, 256-258 no. 3-5, 8 (= J.-L. Heiberg, H.-G. Zenthen (eds.), Paul Tannery, Mémoires scientifiques, 9, pp. 35-37, 45-46, 47, 49-50); the text ends differently from the edition
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 38r-39v

msItem.title: Various astrological texts and tables on the four elements and on the signs of the Zodiac
msItem.note: The texts are also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 40r-45r

msItem.rubric: f. 19v l. 1 Περὶ στοιχείων
msItem.incipit: f. 19v Τέσαρα εἰσὶν τὰ στοιχεία
msItem.note: See C.O. Zuretti, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum graecorum, 11.2, Bruxelles 1934, p. 135
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 40r

msItem.rubric: f. 19v l. 5 Περὶ τῶν ιβ΄ ζῳδίων πόθεν ἔχων τὴν γένησιν
msItem.incipit: f. 19v Ἐκ τοῦ πυρός
msItem.finalRubric: f. 19v Καὶ ταῦτα μὲν περὶ τῶν ιβ΄ ζῳδίων
msItem.note: The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 40r

msItem.incipit: f. 19v l. 26 Ἡμέρᾳ κυριακῇ ὥρᾳ α΄ Ἡλίου
msItem.note: See Zuretti 1934 , pp. 126-131 with differences
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 40r-42v

msItem.title: Astronomical text on the planets
msItem.rubric: f. 22v l. 19 Περὶ ἀστρονομίας ἐποχῆς τοῦ κρόνου
msItem.incipit: f. 22v Εἰσὶν ζ΄ πλανείται
msItem.note: The text, unpublished, is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 42v-43r

msItem.incipit: f. 23r l. 15 Ἡ κυριακῆ ἔχει ἀριθμὸν φνθ΄
msItem.explicit: f. 23r l. 17 ὁ σαββάτον ἔχει ἀριθμὸν ωογ΄
msItem.note: See Zuretti 1934 , p. 125
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 43r

msItem.rubric: f. 23r l. 18 Aὕτη ἐστὶν ἑρμηνεία τοῦ ὀρολογίου
msItem.incipit: f. 23r Μηνὶ ἰανουαρίῳ καὶ δεκεμβριῳ ὥρᾳ α΄ πόδες κη΄
msItem.note: See I. Heeg, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum graecorum, 5.3, Bruxelles 1910, pp. 77-78 and F. Boll, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum graecorum, 7, Bruxelles 1908, pp. 189-190
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 43r-43v

msItem.incipit: f. 23v l. 23 Μηνὶ μαρτίῳ κα΄ ἰσημερία
msItem.note: The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 43v-44r

msItem.incipit: f. 23v l. 36 Τεσσάρων στοιχείων ὄντων
msItem.note: See Boll 1908, pp. 102-104 and Zuretti 1934, p. 135
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 43v-44r

msItem.incipit: f. 24r l. 13 Ἀγαθοποιεῖ μὲν οὖν ο Ζεύς
msItem.note: The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 44r

msItem.rubric: f. 24r l. 24 Περὶ πολεύωντος καὶ διέποντος ἀστέρος ἀστέρα
msItem.note: In the margin, in red ink, by the scribe: ἡμέρᾳ Κρόνου σαββάτῳ, with the symbol of Saturn
msItem.incipit: f. 24r Κρόνου πολεύωντος καὶ διέποντος
msItem.note: The text ends imperfectly, as indicated by the scribe in red ink with λύπει (for λείπει)
The text is similar to Boll 1908, pp. 90-95
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 44r-45v

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 27r Περὶ σεισμῶν, καὶ τῶν δι' αὐτῶν προγνώσεων ἐκ τῶν οὐρανίων ζωδίων λαμβάνων καὶ τοῦ ἡλίου
msItem.incipit: f. 27r Ἀπριλλίῳ μηνὶ Ἡλίου ὄντος ἐν Κριῷ
msItem.note: The text, attributed to Hermes Trismegistus, is incomplete, ed. Boll 1908, pp. 167-171: 167-168 l. 20
The text is also present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 45v

msItem.title: Astrological treatise on the seven planets
msItem.rubric: f. 27v Ὡρολόγιον τῶν ἑπτὰ πλανήτων
msItem.incipit: f. 27v Ὅτι ὁ Κρόνος
msItem.explicit: f. 28r l. 23 οὐκ ἐπ' αὐτῆ τελευτίσει
msItem.note: The text is partially published in Zuretti 1934, pp. 132-133
The text is present also in MS Laur. Plut 86.14, ff. 46r-46v

msItem.title: De natura hominis
msItem.rubric: f. 28r l. 24 Περὶ συστάσεως τοῦ ἀνθρώπου
msItem.incipit: f. 28r Συνίσταται ἄνθρωπος ἐκ τεσάρων στιχείων
msItem.explicit: f. 29r l. 10 ξηρᾶς κράσεως καὶ ὑγρᾶς.
msItem.note: The text is present also in MS Laur. Plut 86.14, f. 46v

msItem.rubric: f. 29r l. 10 Ὅροι σφιγμῶν ιβ΄ κράσεως ψυχρᾶς καὶ ὑγρᾶς
msItem.incipit: f. 29r Ὁ μὲν ἕκτος λακτίζει
msItem.note: The text is present also in MS Laur. Plut 86.14, f. 47r

msItem.title: Ages of man
msItem.incipit: f. 29r l. 16 Ἑπτὰ εἰσὶν κατὰ ἀτρονόμους αἱ τοὺ ἀνδρὸς ἠλικίαι
msItem.note: See F. Boll, 'Die Lebensalter', in: Neue Jahrbücher für das klassische Altertum, Geschichte und deutsche Literatur und für Pädagogik, , 21, 1913, p. 120 l. 2
The text is present also in MS Laur. Plut 86.14, f. 47r

msItem.rubric: f. 29r l. 25 Πρὸς τὸ εὑρεθύναι τὸν κλέπτην
msItem.incipit: f. 29r Λαβὼν τὸ λευκὸν τοῦ ὠοῦ μίνξον μετὰ μολίβδου
msItem.note: Εd. A. Delatte, Anecdota Atheniensia, 1, Liège-Paris 1927, pp. 625-626

msItem.author: Nicolaus de Casulis -1235
msItem.title: The Art of the Scalpel (long version)
Ἡ τοῦ λαξευτηρίου τέχνη
msItem.note: The attribution of all the collection of texts to Nikolaos-Nektarios of Casole is doubtful; only the prologue was certainly written by him (see J.M. Hoeck, R.J. Loenertz, Nikolaos-Nektarios von Otranto Abt von Casole. Beiträge zur Geschichte der ost-westlichen Beziehungen unter Innozenz III. und Friedrich II. (Studia Patristica et Byzantina 11), Passau 1965, pp. 69-74). Also the extension of the work is not clear (the manuscripts do not seem to give precise limits): on the basis of internal elements, it is thought possible that the collection encompassed also the texts which are itemised here as 22-29, (see Hoeck-Loenertz 1965, who did not mention R.15.36 as a manuscript containing the texts, but refer to MS Laur. Plut. 86,14, which has the same contents). The question needs more research; the division here proposed tries simply to follow the succession of titles in the manuscript
Above the frieze preceding the title there is a sentence written in red by the scribe repeating the author: Ποίημα Νεκταρίου καθηγουμένου τῶν Κασούλων

This version of the text is unpublished; see C.O. Zuretti, Catalogus codicum astrologorum graecorum, 4, Bruxelles 1903, pp. 75-76 and Rapisarda-Calcagno 2016, pp. 154-155 notes 8-9, and p. 160; just a part is published in A. Delatte, L. Delatte, 'Un traité byzantin de géomancie', in: Mélanges Franz Cumont (Annuaire de l'Institut de Philologie et d'Histoire Orientales et Slaves 4), 1936, pp. 575-658: 597 l. 15-616 l. 16

msItem.rubric: f. 29v l. 10 Νικολάου Ὑδρούσης προοίμιον, εἰς τὴν τοῦ λαξευτηρίου τέχνην· ἐξελινιστήσαν παῤ αὐτοῦ ἐκ Ῥωμαικῆς διαλέκτου, Χαλδαίαν οὔσαν τὸ πρὶν, καὶ συνταχθήσαν ἔκ τε ἄλλων βίβλων ἑλλινικῶν σποράδην, εἴδη ὑπάρχουσαν
msItem.incipit: f. 29v Τοῖς μετοιαῖνε τι τῶν οἰωνοῦν ἀγαθῶν βουλομένοις

msItem.rubric: f. 31r l. 2 Ἰδοῦ σὺν Θεῶ τῆς περὶ τοῦ λαξευτηρίου ὑποθέσεως ἄρξωμεν
msItem.incipit: f. 31r Ἧς καὶ πεῖραν
msItem.note: A. Delatte, L. Delatte, Un traité byzantin de géomancie, in: Mélanges Franz Cumont (Annuaire de l'Institut de Philologie et d'Histoire Orientales et Slaves 4), 1936, pp. 575-658: 597 l. 15-616 l. 16

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 47v l. 18 Πάλιν περὶ τῶν σχημάτων σημασίας
msItem.incipit: f. 47v Δέον εἰδέναι ὅτι τῶν ιϛ΄ ἡμερῶν
msItem.note: Εd. A. Delatte, L. Delatte, Un traité byzantin de géomancie, in: Mélanges Franz Cumont (Annuaire de l'Institut de Philologie et d'Histoire Orientales et Slaves 4), 1936, pp. 575-658: 616 l. 17-618 l. 30 (from MS Paris, Bibliothèque Nationale de France, gr. 2419, ff. 232v-233r), where this text is part of the same Byzantine treatise of geomancy which comprises also an extract from Nicolaus de Casulis' work (here ff. 31r-47v), and the geomantic texts of ff. 47v-49r, 50r-51v and 52r-53r

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise, attributed to Buseth
msItem.rubric: f. 49r l. 16 Νοήματα Βουσὴθ φιλοσόφου περὶ σημασίας σχημάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 49r Ὁ Ἥλιος ἐν τῷ πρώτῳ οἴκω
msItem.note: The text is unpublished; the same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 63r ss. and in MS Oxon. Auct. T.5.8, f. 196, attributed to Σηβός

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 50r l. 16 Πρὸς τὸ γνῶναι τὴν τύχην εἴτε τὴν εἱμαρμένην ἑκάστης ἡμέρας
msItem.incipit: f. 50r Ἡνίκα βούλει γνῶναι τὴν εἱμαρμένην ἑκάστης ἡμέρας
msItem.explicit: f. 51v l. 7 ἐξ ἴσου ἀριθμοῦ τὸ γενόμενον
msItem.note: Ed. A. and L. Delatte 1936, pp. 619 l. 14-621 l. 22, where this text is part of the same Byzantine treatise of geomancy which comprises also an extract from Nicolaus de Casulis' work (here ff. 31r-47v), and the geomantic texts of ff. 47v-49r, 50r-51v and 52r-53r

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 51v l. 7 Περὶ τῆς τῶν σχημάτων συμπλοκῆς
msItem.incipit: f. 51v Τέσσαρα τῶν ἀνωτέρω ῥηθέντων σχημάτων
msItem.note: Τhe same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 63r and Oxford, Bodleian library, MS Auct. T.5.8, f. 212r

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 52r l. 3 Πάλιν περὶ τῆς αὐτῶν ποιότητος
msItem.incipit: f. 52r Ὁ γελάστης, ἡ ὑπόκυψις
msItem.note: Ed. A. and L. Delatte 1936, pp. 621 l. 23-623 l. 31, where this text is part of the same Byzantine treatise of geomancy which comprises also an extract from Nicolaus de Casulis' work (here ff. 31r-47v), and the geomantic texts of ff. 47v-49r, 50r-51v and 52r-53r

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 53r l. 21 Περὶ τῶν μερῶν, τῶν ἐν ταῖς γέναις, καὶ ἐν πᾶσι ζητίμασι, ἐν ὀνόματι κυρίου
msItem.incipit: f. 53r Ῥηταίον περῖ τῶν μερῶν τῆς τύχης
msItem.note: Ed. A. and L. Delatte 1936, pp. 624-625 l. 8, where this text is part of the same Byzantine treatise of geomancy which comprises also an extract from Nicolaus de Casulis' work (here ff. 31r-47v), and the geomantic texts of ff. 47v-49r, 50r-51v and 52r-53r

msItem.title: Various geomantic texts

list.item: f. 54r ll. 3-11 Περὶ τοῦ γνῶναι ζωὴν τινός
f. 54r ll. 12-26 Περὶ μοιχείας ἠ πορνίας γυναικός
ff. 54r l. 27-54v l. 4 inc. Ὀπόταν ἑρωτιθείς
f. 54v ll. 5-11 Ἄλλο πρὸς τὸ νοεῖσαι τὶς ἠ πεῦσις τοῦ ἐλθόντος διὰ τὸ ἑροτῆσαι
f. 54v l. 11 Καὶ τοῦτο εὖρον ἐγὼ Νικόλαος ἀληθὲς ἐκ πείρας

msItem.note: Τhe same texts are present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 67v-68r

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 56r l. 16 Ἀρχὴ τῶν κεφαλαίων ἐν τῆ σημασία τῶν σχημάτων ἐν ὀνόματι κυρίου
msItem.incipit: f. 56r Ἡ εἴσοδος καὶ ἡ ἔξοδος
msItem.note: A. and L. Delatte 1936, p. 625 l. 9-658, where this text is part of the same Byzantine treatise of geomancy which comprises also an extract from Nicolaus de Casulis' work (here ff. 31r-47v), and the geomantic texts of ff. 47v-49r, 50r-51v and 52r-53r, 53r-54r
Τhe same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 69v-94r

msItem.rubric: f. 86r Κύκλος τοῦ Πετοσιρι
msItem.note: Diagram
In the upper margin, by another hand, in black ink, Petosiris

msItem.title: Ἐπιστολὴ Πετοσίρεως φιλοσόφου πρὸς Νεκεψὼ βασιλέα
msItem.rubric: f. 86r Πετοσήρις Νεψεχὼ Νεχεψὼ τιμιωτάτω βασιλεῖ χαίρειν
msItem.incipit: f. 87r Περὶ ἑνὸς ἑκάστου τῶν ὑπ’ ἐμοῦ εὑρημένων
msItem.explicit: f. 87v l. 27 ὁ κίνδυνος ἢ οὔ
msItem.note: The text here ends differently than the printed one

TLG 0995.006 (A. Olivieri, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum Graecorum, 4: 'Codices Italici', Brussels 1903, pp. 120-121; see also C.O. Zuretti, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum Graecorum, 11.2: 'Codices Hispanienses', Brussels 1934, p. 152 ss.)

msItem.title: Οnomantical text
msItem.rubric: f. 87v l. 27 Ψῆφος τῶν ἐβδοματικῶν ἡμερῶν ἀκριβῆς διαγνωσικὸς ζωῆς καὶ θανάτου
msItem.incipit: f. 88r Μάθε ποίαν ἡμέραν
msItem.note: Εd. P. Tannery, Notices et extraits des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque nationale et autres bibliothèques, 31.2, pp. 259-260 (= J.-L. Heiberg, H.-G. Zenthen (eds.), Paul Tannery, Mémoires scientifiques, 9, Paris 1886, p. 47 no.10)
The text is followed by a diagram (see Tannery 1886, p. 260)

msItem.title: Epistula, fragmentum
msItem.incipit: f. 88v οἱ καὶ πρώτερον

msItem.title: Geomantic text
msItem.rubric: f. 89r Ἀρχὴ τῶν τοῦ λαξευτηρίου κρίσεων ἐν ὀνόματι Κυρίου
msItem.incipit: f. 89r Πρῶτον περὶ συνάξεως. Ἡ σύναξις ἀφ’ἑαυτῆς
msItem.note: The text is still unpublished

msItem.title: Diagram with explanation
msItem.rubric: f. 89r Σημεῖα οὐρανοῦ καὶ γῆς
msItem.incipit: f. 89r Εἰς τὰ ἄκρα τῆς γῆς κατὰ τὰ δ΄ μέρη αὐτῆς
msItem.note: The text accompanies a diagram of the structure of heaven and Earth, partially coloured in red, with the inscription: Ἱστορία Διονισίου τοῦ Ἀρεοπαγίτου
The text echoes, with some differences, Cosmas, Indicopleustes, active 6th century Cosmas Indicopleustes , Topographia Christiana (TLG 4061.002), book 4 section 3

msItem.title: Epigram (Anth. Pal. App. III, 239)
msItem.incipit: f. 121v Κριὸς προηγός ἐστιν ἀρχή τε χρόνου
msItem.explicit: f. 121v οἱ δ’ Ἰχθύες, δήλωσις ἰχθύων γένους
msItem.note: The text is accompanied by a diagram with the zodiac

msItem.title: Noah's ark with explanation
msItem.rubric: f. 122r Ἡ κιβωτός ὴν ὀ δίκαιος Νώε κατεσκεύασεν
msItem.incipit: f. 122r Πατρὸς ὀρθοδόξου
msItem.note: The text accompanies an illustration of Noah's ark; the same text is found in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 120v

msItem.title: Calculation of years from Adam until Constantine
msItem.incipit: f. 122r Ἀπὸ Ἀδὰμ ἕως τοῦ κατακλισμοῦ
msItem.note: The text accompanies an illustration of Noah's ark; the same text is found in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 121r

msItem.rubric: f. 122r Περὶ τοῦ γνῶναι ἄρωστον
msItem.incipit: f. 122r Ἡμέρᾳ α΄ τῆς Σελήνης
msItem.note: The same text is found in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 121r
See, different, C.O. Zuretti, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum Graecorum, 11,2, Bruxelles 1934, p. 151

msItem.rubric: f. 122v Περὶ διαγνώσεως ἀρόστου καὶ τῶν γενομένων παίδων
msItem.incipit: f. 122v Τῆς σελήνης αἰ ἠμέραι
msItem.note: The text is accompanied by a diagram with title Αἱ τῆς σελήνης πεφωτισμένης ἠμέραι
The same text, with the diagram, is found in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 121r-121v; see Zuretti 1934, p. 154

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 123r Ἀπὸ τῶν κρίσεων, ἀπὸ ἑτέρου βιβλίου
msItem.incipit: f. 123r Ἐν ἄλλῳ οὕτω ὀρίζει
msItem.note: The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 122r-126v

msItem.title: Geomantic treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 128r l. 17 Ἀρχὴ σὺν θεῷ τῶν συντόμων κρίσεων
msItem.incipit: f. 128r Περίοδοι πορίας
msItem.note: The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 127r-133r

msItem.title: Calendrical meteorological text attributed to the prophet Esdras
msItem.rubric: f. 132v Ἐσδρὰ τοῦ προφήτου· κάλανδα ἠκριβωμένα τῆς εὐδομάδος
msItem.incipit: f. 132v Κυριακῇ ἡμέρᾳ εἰ γένονται κάλανδα
msItem.note: Ed. R. Wünsch, 'Zu Lydus de ostentis', in: Byzantinische Zeitschrift 5,3 (1895), pp. 410-421: 419-420; M. Boissonade, 'Traité alimentaire du médecin Hiérophile, extrait de deux manuscrits de la Bibliothèque du Roi', in: Notices et extraits des manuscrits de la Bibliothèque Nationale et autres bibliothèques, 11,2, Paris 1827, pp. 186-187
The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 134r-134v

msItem.author: Cassianus Bassus
msItem.title: Geoponica, extract
msItem.rubric: f. 133r l. 20 Περὶ τοῦ ζῳδιακοῦ κύκλου καὶ ὅσα ὁ Ζεὺς ἀπιτέλει τοὺς ιβ΄ οἴκους τοῦ ζῳδιακοῦ κύκλου καὶ περὶ τοῦ δωδεκαετήρου Διός
msItem.incipit: f. 133r Ὁ ζῳδιακὸς κύκλος τέμνεται εἰς δώδεκα οἴκους
msItem.note: The text is an extract from Cassianus Bassus' Geoponica, H. Beckh, Geoponica, Leipzig 1895, pp. 21-28, book 1 ch. 12
The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 134v-137r

msItem.author: John, of Damascus
msItem.title: Expositio fidei, excerptum
msItem.rubric: f. 136v Περὶ ἀνθρώπου
msItem.incipit: f. 136v Οὕτω μὲν οὖν τὴν νοητὴν οὐσίαν
msItem.note: The text is an exceprt from John of Damascus' Expositio fidei, P.B. Kotter, Die Schriften des Johannes von Damaskos, 2, Berlin 1973, pp. 75-76, 26 linn. 1-25
The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 137r

msItem.title: Diagramma zonarum
msItem.rubric: f. 136v Ζῶναι οὐρανίαι εἰσὶν ἑπτὰ· ἐν μὲν τῇ πρῶτῃ ὁ κρόνος
msItem.note: The same diagram is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, f. 137v

msItem.title: Astronomical treatise
msItem.rubric: f. 137v Ἀρχὴ σὺν θεῷ τῆς ἀστρονομίας
msItem.incipit: f. 137v Ἰδοῦ βλέπομεν, ὅτι ὁ οὐρανὸς
msItem.note:
The text is accompanied by a diagram on f. 137v; it comprises some titles:
f. 138v Περὶ τῶν ἑπτὰ ζωνῶν
f. 139v Περὶ ἐπομβρίας ; it ends imperfectly due to the loss of leaves
The same text is present in MS Laur. Plut. 86.14, ff. 137v-142v

On this text, a collection of cosmological and atronomical texts, which comprises a text about the heaven, a text about the structure of the Earth, and a version of the astronomical text of Peter the Philosopher (on this last text, see A.-L. Caudano, '«Le ciel a la forme d'un cube ou a étédressé comme une peau» : Pierre le Philosophe ou l'orthodoxie du savoir astronomique sous Manuel 1er Comnène', in: Byzantion 81 (2011), pp. 19-73), see A.-L. Caudano, 'Cosmologies et cosmographies variées dans les manuscrits byzantins tardifs', in: Byzantion 85 (2015), pp. 1-25 (MS Trinity R.15.36 is not mentioned)

support.material: ff. [i]-[ii], [iii]-[iv] Western paper, folded in quarto, with traces of a watermark with a cross and letters A C (only half of it is visible). These are later endleaves which came with the binding.

foliation.p: Modern pencil foliation, in Arabic numerals, in the upper margin, right; two later endleaves at the beginning and two at the end of the manuscript are unnumbered: [i]-[ii] + 1-139 + [iii]-[iv].

collation.p: The manuscript consists mainly of quaternions.

list.item: Quire 38-2 ff. 16-21(γ΄. 2 stubs indicate the loss of the 2nd and 6th leaves)

collation.signatures: Greek signatures in red ink by the scribe in the lower margin of the first recto and last verso of the quires, not visible throughout the whole manuscript, from α΄ (1, f. 7v), to ι΄ (10, f. 70r).

supportDesc.condition: The edges of the leaves are very fragile. Some leaves are partially detached along the gutter; on the internal margin of f. 7v has been pasted a paper strip with Greek script in black ink, coming from another manuscript, probably in order to reinforce the leaf. The lower right margin of f. 104r has been cut. Along the edges of the leaves there are passim traces of red ink, from the colouring of the edges (see e.g. f. [i] recto).

layoutDesc.layout: The layout is not regular, a single column of 29 to 32 lines. 180 110

handNote.p: ff.1r-139v Hand A: the texts have been written by a single hand in a minuscule script of small size, upright, cursive, fluent; the script and the decoration of the manuscript point to an origin in the Italian region of Otranto, the script is similar to the barocca otrantina (on this script see D. Arnesano, La minuscola «barocca». Scritture e libri in Terra d'Otranto nei secoli XIII e XIV, Galatina 2008) of the XIV century .
The text is written in a light brown ink; titles and initials in red. The scribe did not use iota subscript and made frequent errors.
In the margins throughout there are titles written in a minuscule script by a later hand, see e.g. f. 1r.

decoDesc.decoNote: The decoration is simple and has been traced by the scribe. On f. 4v there is a headpiece with a geometrical motif of rhombuses, partially coloured in red ink; there is a smaller one on f. 45r. On f. 24r there is a small headpiece coloured in red ink containing a geometrical pattern in negative.

There are various friezes in red ink:
ff. 60v, 87r, 91v, 122r, 123r, 133r, formed by alternating motifs of small commas and two parallel lines, with vegetal motifs at both ends (on f. 122r the frieze is used as a line-filler)
ff. 1r, 3r, 3v, 7v, 17v, 22v, 29v, 36v, 43v, 89r, 47v, 50r-50v, 54r, 68r, 77v, 89r, 132v rope motifs in red or brown ink
ff. 3r, 46r, 69r, 128r chain motifs
ff. 20r-20v, 41v ribbons with knots, or, ff. 20v-22v simple ribbons
ff. 23r-23v, 42r undulated linear motifs
Thick initials in ekthesis, in red ink, with a very simple geometrical decoration. A few initials are more elaborately decorated, see e.g. ff. 39v, 43r, 74v (anthropomorphic).

Some of the texts are accompanied by diagrams of simple execution, sometimes with particulars coloured in red, see ff. 84v, 86r, 121r, 121v, 122r, 137r, 137v, and by tables, which sometimes show decorated frames, see ff. 15v, 16r, 18v, 19r, 84v-85v, 88r, 122v, 128r-132r.

additions.p: On the left pastedown is written the present shelfmark R.15.36.
In the lower margin of f. 1v two incomplete decoration motifs with a geometrical pattern of rhombuses have been traced in the same ink of the text.
On f. 2v there are scattered notes, written transversa charta in Latin alphabet (pen trials).
Scattered notes in Greek are present in the lower margin of f. 3r.
Scattered notes in Greek by hands with a limited writing education are present throughout the manuscript, see ff. 9v, 16v, 17r.
On f. 26v there is a note in Greek mentioning the year 1531.

binding.p: Western binding, full leather cover over pasteboards. Blind tooling on the boards' edges. Gold tooling on spine with title Nectarii Astronomia Gr., MS; on the spine are pasted three paper labels with the shelfmark, R, 15, 36. Edges coloured in red; on the foredge, in the upper part, is written in black ink the number 8 (?). 232 155 50

origin.p: The manuscript is not dated. On the basis of the script, it can be dated probably to the 14th century, possibly the first half; the use of eastern paper is in line with this date.

history.acquisition: In all likelihood, it was donated to the Library by Thomas Nevile (ca. 1548-1615) Nevile, Thomas, -1615 , Master of Trinity College and Dean of Canterbury, in the years 1611-1612 (for the provenance fron Nevile, see James 1900, pp. xxii and 147; for the date of the donation see P. Gaskell, Trinity College Library: the first 150 years. The Sandars Lectures 1978-9, Cambridge 1980, p. 81). On the left pastedown is pasted the Trinity College bookplate. Stamps of Trinity College Library are present on ff. 1r, 6r, 314r.

recordHist.source: Description (2020) draws partly on M. R. James, The Western Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College Cambridge, vol. 1, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 1900, p. 147, and on S. Weinstock, Catalogus Codicum Astrologorum Graecorum, 9.2, Bruxelles 1953, pp. 48-54.

availability.p: Visitors to Trinity College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Trinity College: Information for Readers.

monogr.title: Teachers, Students, and Schools of Greek in the Renaissance

analytic.title: The prediction method by means of the Holy Gospel and the Psalter: a late Byzantine case of a reassigned geomantic text

monogr.title: Savoirs prédictifs et techniques divinatoires de l'Antiquité tardive à Byzance
